intro: Alsine picta var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial species that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features small, white flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and it has a compact growth habit. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and dry fields.
